title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 25.2 - Prior approval of notice to stockholders
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 25.2 - Prior approval of notice to stockholders

State Regulations

For the reasons stated in section
25.1
of this Part, the Banking

Board hereby authorizes the superintendent, whenever an order has been issued
to any bank or trust company pursuant to Banking Law, section 39, in his or her
discretion, to require such corporate banking organization to submit to him or
her, for his or her prior approval, any proposed notice to stockholders of any
meeting of stockholders to be held within two years after the date of issuance
of such order, any solicitation of proxies for such meeting and any other
communication to stockholders concerning such meeting (all hereinafter included
in the term "notice to stockholders"). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
25.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
